alert.note: Alert for Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 5:21PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Pike County through 600 PM EDT... At 521 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Mcandrews, or 8 miles south of Williamson, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Phelps and Buskirk around 530 PM EDT. Board Tree and Jamboree around 535 PM EDT. Majestic around 540 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Woodman and Argo. THIS INCLUDES U.S. Highway 119 in Pike County between mile markers 15 and 20. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
